Author: Brenda Ariesty Kusumasari
Review: This bridge is quite famous and has a wonderful view during clear day. Unfortunately we went during rainy and extremely cloudy day so not much view was feasible. But the mist on the surrounding hills was somehow majestic. Lots of people take photos with this bridge as background. There are some gentleman offering rickshaw tour. The bridge itself is pretty crowded with vehicles so just be aware your safety during walking.

Author: Tomoki Yoshida
Review: Very nice view!!  I recommend it to everyone!!

Author: Kyoto Dream Trips
Review:
Watching the Harvest Moon rising over the Togetsuky≈ç Bridge in Arashiyama.
The almost full Harvest Moon (Waxing Gibbous 98.8%) coming over the Mountains surrounding Arashiyama. A few people were waiting for the moonrise, and when it became visible, there were some shrieks of excitement. Some shivers went down my spine, and it's always thrilling to experience it. Hundreds of years ago, the Kyoto aristocracy came here to watch the Harvest Moon and recite poetry. I wonder what else they did. No wonder the Togetsuky≈ç bridge is fittingly called the "Moon Crossing Bridge".

Author: Puja Pandey
Review: Its a popular bridge but did not get a good view of fall as seen on other sites.

Author: Owasiul Islam
Review: Very crowed during this lighting time of autumn!

Author: Tsuyoshi Ookura
Review: Great place to have walking!!

Author: Saurabh
Review: One of the oldest bridges in Japan, first constructed around 900 AD (during Nara period). The whole bridge is illuminated with vibrant purple lighting during training the 2nd and 3rd week of December, locally called the Hanatoro event. Be mindful that if you take the JR line or Randen, you will arrive at the Saga Arashiyama station which is already on the right side of bridge and towards Arashiyama bamboo forest. To start from the beginning of the bridge, you would need to take the Hankyu line to arrive at Hankyu Arashiyama station, different from Saga Arashiyama station.

Author: Mark Lentz
Review: I mean, it is a cool bridge.

Author: Amari Rae Pulido
Review: I walk for two hours to cross Togetsu-kyo and sit by the Oigawa River! During the day, small boats are available for rent. üö£ The bridge connects the Bamboo and Kimono Forest area to the Monkey Park. Many attractions near the bridge, including Arabica Coffee, restaurants, the main shopping street, and numerous shrines.

Author: Santosh Shrestha
Review:
One of the oldest bridge in japan.
Was built about 900AD.
Watched many times in TV and finally able to watch live.
Takes about 10min to cross the bridge.
It really has a historical value.
However I would say its just a normal bridge.

Author: Possanunt Charoenkijkajorn
Review: Somebody told me that if you walk on the bridge and pray, that will come true. But never look back. üòä True or not, the bridge is beautiful as always. Even it rains, don't be upset. The atmosphere is different, hope you can see double rainbow here.

Author: George Chalhoub
Review: Interesting bridge

Author: Rahul Bam
Review: Beautiful view around the bridge. So much cultural vibe, lively and festive.

Author: Beezer Wagler Music
Review: We walked this bridge on our way to the monkey park.  What a beautiful area and what a fantastic memory

Author: Enzo Wong
Review: Beautiful bridge, there are many places to visit nearby by crossing it. There were also some shops and restaurants as well.

Author: Div
Review: This bridge is featured in many dramas, films & anime. Night view is really recommended.

Author: Anne Fernando
Review: Provides a scenic view especially during autumn with the iconic fall colors of red, orange, and yellow. If you go down on one side, you can try a boat ride (for a fee) and get a close look on nature surrounding this famous bridge.

Author: HedgeHodge ‚ÄúHodgePodge‚Äù
Review: That‚Äôs a good bridge

Author: Kin Chan
Review: The bridge and the river make this a unique photo spot. Both the people and the wild birds are enjoying this peaceful place together. Rather than just taking photos, we sit down on the bench and absorbing the sense of harmony with quality time. No rush. So relax.

Author: Than Dar
Review: Even without fall color yet, the experience of the openness of the space is more lovely than the picture

Author: Timothy HALL
Review: An important bridge to see, if not cross, when visiting eastern Kyoto while sightseeing. Sitting along the bank of the river is also an option while people-watching is also another easy way to unwind after a day of walking around and sight-seeing. Come around sunset for nice views of the trees in fall.

Author: Pallab Pain
Review: You get some beautiful views from this bridge especially during the golden hours of the day and a clear sky.

Author: Michel Dewolfs
Review: Nice walking but to crowded

Author: Juliana Jaen
Review: Great place to visit with nice weather.

Author: Lu Bi Huang
Review: Gorgeous bridge with excellent views from all angles. There are plenty of seating available on both sides of the bridge and plenty of rubbish bins after you've enjoyed the local snacks. Alternatively, you can sit along the river banks and get much closer to the water.

Author: Jeffrey Tanujaya
Review: Very beautiful bridge on the way to Arashiyama forest.

Author: Summer
Review:
Very crowded. The light comes from behind the mountains so that it is hard to get a good picture of the fall foliage on the bridge. However, if you walk alongside the river toward Shoraian(if you want to eat there definitely make a reservation ahead of time) you will
get many good photo opportunities.

Author: Kenny Mok
Review: Must visit

Author: K L
Review: Best to visit early to avoid crowds

Author: Noe Koko
Review: An old samurai movies style bridge. It will enchant you for its straight architecture, length, and complete absence of any protection rails or any other system to prevent people to fall down into the river. It's really amazing!

Author: RK Hill
Review: Arashiyama area isn‚Äôt my favorite. It looks cheap. The bridge may be beautiful, but I was already let down by its cheap atmosphere, and didn‚Äôt enjoy the view.

Author: Cee
Review: Nice stroll

Author: Ken Teh
Review: Windy and can have nice view here but it is super crowded..

Author: Autchi JinZawa
Review: Beautiful

Author: Spanya Uawithya
Review: 2nd Dec. Sunny day with blue sky

Author: Ky Lee
Review: Enjoyed the nice sunset view here during my vacation!!

Author: Lee Fielding
Review: Truly amazingly beautiful experience, heaps of shops and things to do and see, you must go yourself you'll love it üáØüáµüáØüáµ‚ù§Ô∏è

Author: Spencer Kok
Review: Beautiful river separated by this Bridge. Must go! View is superb!

Author: W Wang
Review: Th famous tourist mark that you must have taken.

Author: Brian Lin
Review: Arashiyama is such a beautiful place and the view from this bridge is simply gorgeous.

Author: Anze Hao
Review: Nice area to walk around

Author: ArmRatch
Review: Nice vibe at here in evening.

Author: Ni N.
Review: Beautiful scenery. We went early morning and many people already there. 10am is very crowded - with all the tourist buses arrived.

Author: Kyle Gesek
Review: Went at night. Got stuck in Kyoto due to snow storm. Might be cursed.

Author: Asma Desai
Review: Great views - would like to come back in the summer

Author: Trevor Huffman
Review: Neat to look at. The river is everything you think of for Asia. The bridge itself is a bit crowded with people

Author: Hwei Ann Low
Review: A place that you must go to take wonderful photos.

Author: Charles Strickland
Review: Lovely bridge with amazing views up and down the river. Only issue is it‚Äôs crazy busy with tourists so difficult to get a good photo.

Author: Joowan Gil
Review: As soon as you get off the bus and enters this place, you finally feel like you are in Kyoto.

Author: Anastasia G
Review:
Beautiful bridge with the monkey reserve and bamboo forest nearby.
A ton of restaurants and cafe around.
There are plenty of souvenir shops.
You can also find several rickshaws close to the bridge entry.

Author: Juicy (Juicy)
Review: Beautiful river, mountain, and bridge

Author: Robert Tan
Review:
1 of the few place u might (eventually) stroll to after visiting Arashiyama Bamboo Forest while shopping along the Arashiyama shopping belt.
Scenic area for many to consider taking photos, further down the river, there are people canoeing.
There are stone benches along the river that allows people to sit and ‚Äúpicnic‚Äù while admiring the beauty of this location.

Author: Johnny B
Review: They were rebuilding some roads there so the view was lame

Author: david cheah wei heng
Review: There is a good and chill place to view  sightseeing place

Author: Shawn Hing
Review: Lovely esp when snowing

Author: Tze Hui Cheam
Review: Stunning scenery which makes for beautiful photos. Short walk from the bamboo forest and food street.

Author: Sin Man Lam
Review: Beautiful place

Author: Mi Yeung
Review:
Stunning view and chill. Feel relive and blessing. Suggest spend half an hour and grab a coffee to enjoy the view.

#kyoto#travel

Author: Winter Phoenix Forest Kirin (WinterPhoenixForestKirin)
Review: It was truly inspiring. You HAVE to come here if you are in Kyoto. The river is very melodic.

Author: Dao
Review: Absolutely beautiful. Amazing view of the area and a great atmosphere.

Author: Rebecca Ho Sze Moon
Review: The love for this place never end.

Author: Harry Wray
Review: Beautiful bridge with some amazing views. Not worth a trip to Arashiyama by itself, but if you‚Äôre already coming for the monkey park or the bamboo forest, you‚Äôll probably cross over it anyways and be glad you did.

Author: Alesis L
Review: Despite the weather, it's a nice scenery from the bridge

Author: Romuald
Review: Nearby temple is wonderful, lots of souvenir shops and street snacks/food

Author: Raksanali S.
Review: Beautiful place but little bit rainy in March

Author: ÌóàÏö©ÏÑù
Review: Good-.,

Author: Erivan
Review: Cure wood bridge from where you can see spring blossoms, fall colors and mountains.

Author: Tan Jia Thiam
Review: Great place for a short picnic and some boat activity

Author: Peter Lee
Review: Go early in the morning otherwise the bridge can get full of people.

Author: Mark Ng
Review: Beautiful scenery especially when Sakura is in full bloom across the bridge ...

Author: vu minh
Review: Fresh air to escape the crowd, saw lots of ducks swimming on the river. The bridge connects the monkey park and shopping area.

Author: Bj√∂rn Ebner
Review: It's a bridge. Yeah, that's about it.

Author: Kate Lim
Review: One of my favourite places in Kyoto. Awesome site to chill and watch the waters. Surrounded by shops to purchase souvenirs and snacks too!

Author: Henry Edwards
Review: Bridge kinda meh. Walk along rinse toward gorge was best past

Author: Roee
Review: A nice view over the river, I recommend bringing something to eat and just sit by the river and enjoy the view. If you‚Äôre on your way to the monkey shrine you should pass by the bridge.

Author: Angie Lee
Review:
2 Apr 23:
Sturdy-looking wooden bridge that allows people to cross the Katsura River. There were a lot of tourists during the time we're here.

Author: Alyssa Becker
Review: Beautiful but very crowded bridge.  Looking at it over the river is much nicer than trying to cross it (at almost any time of day).  We were there at 4:30 PM and it was hard not to fall off the sidewalk with the number of people.  But it didn't help that people would randomly stop every few meters for pictures either.  Way cross as needed - but don't expect to be amazed by the experience.  To enjoy the bridge, sit on a bench along the river and stare at it from a distance.  Then you get to see the rushing water and cherry blossoms (or fall colours) and ignore the people.

Author: Lim Hock Chuan
Review: Nice place n scenery

Author: Elisabet Aggianoglou
Review: Very beautiful nature

Author: SL Wong
Review: Of course, if you're in the Arayashima region, you will pass by this iconic bridge. It links the bamboo forest and the monkey forest and there's some shopping around the region.

Author: Abu Hasan Mohammad Khaled
Review: Awesome‚Ä¶

Author: joel
Review: A great area to stroll and relax with the family. The street at the end of the bridge offered a pleasant shopping experience and it is connected to tenryu-ji and bamboo forest. Family with kids and elderly can easily spend a day in Arashiyama

Author: Vash Vash
Review: Lovely place to see old historical buildings(temples)with beautiful nature.

Author: David Cy
Review: Cool touristy area to see the water. Lots of small shops around here as well.

Author: Bryan Y
Review: The beauty of the mountains and river, one needs to just experience this place with their own eyes.

Author: Vgs photos
Review: Majestic bridge crossing Katsura river. So relaxing to just walk across while hearing the soft flows of the river gush by! Can get very busy but crowds are managable and still feels peaceful

Author: MengYee
Review: Located next to the shopping street, very nice and scenic just for the photos. Have to take the photo from the bank of the river to get its nice view. But there are basically nothing much on the other side of it. I crossed it and got lost because I thought the bamboo forest is across it..

Author: 41DRE
Review: Amazing place to take pictures with great scenery and has calming vibes

Author: Banano Musclor
Review: The bridge is random, but the view is super nice. Near the bridge you can go to the monkey hill.

Author: N N
Review: Not to be missed

Author: A'isyah Kartika Sari
Review: Never get bored of visiting this bridge when going to Arashiyama. The surrounding scenery is simply stunning, especially in autumn! All the trees around were of various colors. So pretty.

Author: Leslie Lee
Review: By chance, I stumbled upon this bridge during my exploration, as it wasn't initially part of my planned itinerary. However, I couldn't have been happier with the unexpected discovery. The view from the bridge was absolutely breathtaking, boasting a picturesque scene that captured my attention immediately. It was a true feast for the eyes, and I couldn't resist taking several photos to preserve the beauty of the moment. Sometimes the best experiences are the ones that happen spontaneously, and this unplanned encounter certainly left a lasting impression on me.

Author: Porsche Tan
Review: Very good scenery but too crowded during the golden week. Could hardly took a photo because people kept walking on both side of the bridge but very relax when sit on the river bank and listen to the sound of water.

Author: Kelly K
Review: Loved it. Great spot

Author: KIM DEAN
Review: I feel peace here

Author: Alia Shapiro
Review: The surrounding view around the bridge is spectacular! It is near monkey park iwatayama and bamboo grove. This bridge is a must visit!

Author: Eddy Duffy
Review: Supposedly a must do, if in Kyoto. Special bridge over a fast flowing river, which was at low levels when we visited. Great shopping street nearby.

Author: Yuwah
Review: Beautiful river. We walked along both sides of the river to get great views of the gorge and surrounding foliage. Also, when you follow katsura riverbank and hike into kameyame park from that side, you will get immediate acces to the nicest part of the bamboo forest and avoid all the crowds at the beginning of bamboo forest where the usual tourists clog up the path.

Author: Atan Knows What U Did
Review: Absolutely stunning. I could stand at the bridge and watch the waters flow by all day. Recommend to get a seat near the river and enjoy some snacks and drinks. Will be worth every minute of your time.

Author: Khaing Min Than
Review: Nice view
